data.title: ReFi Lagos Community
data.description:
ReFi Lagos is a **ReFi DAO Local Node** and grassroots initiative empowering climate ambassadors and nature stewards to scale climate solutions and improve livelihoods. 

Launched in 2023, ReFi Lagos serves as a hub for changemakers leveraging technology and regenerative finance principles to address climate challenges in Africa. We are focusing on scaling climate education and creating regenerative economic solutions that empower indigenous communities and restore natural ecosystems.
data.problem:
Africa's climate crisis is complex. Temperatures in the Sahel region are rising 1.5 times faster than the global average, due to increased urbanization and severe deforestation, both of which increases carbon emissions. Africa faces a funding shortage for climate mitigation and adaptation, and existing financial systems often favor extractive businesses over ecological restoration. Climate change costs Africa $15 billion per year, which exceeds the GDPs of 26 African countries. By 2050, it could reach $50 billion

Climate change impacts disadvantaged communities and threatens traditional livelihoods. With poor access to climate finance, farmers/land stewards are unable to adapt. According to the Food and Agriculture Organization, more than 90% of African smallholder farmers lack access to formal credit, limiting their investment in land restoration. Climate-induced displacement in the Sahel region has resulted in rural-urban migration, climate refugees and an increase in violent extremist groups in the region. 

Climate illiteracy and coordination failures pose significant difficulties in combating climate change in Africa. Over 61% of Nigerians, particularly farmers, do not understand climate change and lack the right tools to tackle it.

 Climate impacts and risks will increase without climate education and coordination tools
data.solution:
**ReFi Lagos** is promoting climate education and coordination platforms for changemakers. We are promoting climate adaptation through community-based research, design and development of innovative climate solutions. Here are some of our ecosystem projects 

**Project OSISI** is an indigenous tree-planting festival platform that allows impact contributors to efficiently support tree-planting festivals with real-time data and impact reports. |  www.osisi.earth

**Project Afrilearn** is advancing climate, Web3, and ReFi education in Africa. Empowering the next generation of climate ambassadors with seasonal training and workshops. | www.afrilearn.com.ng 

**Solatrify Nigeria** is a solar wholesale distribution company that provides Africa's solar businesses, EPCs, and self-installers with reliable, high-quality solar equipment. Solatrify is enabling energy-water nexus. | www.solatrify.com
data.missionSummary: To transform Africa's economic landscape by demonstrating how regenerative finance can simultaneously address climate challenges, create economic opportunities, and restore natural ecosystems
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Supporting sourcing and nursing of tree seedlings at OSISI Garden 

Supporting climate ambassadors/stewards through tree planting bounties 

Production og Regen Environmental Card Games 

Promoting Climate research and content

data.title: ReFi DAO Local Node - Gitcoin Beta Round

data.description: Organize climate change awareness and tree planting events using the Silvi protocol.
data.title: Organize a IRL climate awareness and tree planting event using Silvi protocol

data.reason:
Today, June 25th, 2024, ReFi Lagos stewards and other nature lovers organized an awesome climate awareness and tree-planting event at Omole Junior/Senior Grammar School in Ikeja Lagos. The event empowered about 700 high school students, 75 of whom participated directly in the tree-planting activity. The event featured eco-friendly games and the distribution of learning materials (exercise books) by the @Afri_Learn project.  



 Here's a Twitter (X) post of the event. https://tinyurl.com/OmoleSchoolProject

data.description: Conduct in-depth research, interviews, and case studies on plastic pollution in Nigeria. Challenges and potential opportunities
data.title: Research and Content On Plastic Pollution and Climate Change in Nigeria

data.reason:
- Analyzed the environmental and health impact of plastic waste in Nigeria

- The role of  circular economy, Web3, and regenerative finance in unlocking climate finance 

- Explored potential market opportunities, solutions, and Web3 use cases in Nigeria

data.description: Project Olókun represents our grassroots approach to addressing deforestation. By organizing tree planting events with landowners, tree planters and local volunteers, we aim to restore Nigeria's depleted forests. To ensure transparency and accountability, we've partnered with Silvi Protocol (Operation WebTree) to track tree planting efforts on the blockchain, rewarding tree planters more fairly and transparently

data.title: Scaling Climate and Web3 Education in Africa
data.description: Collaborated on the design and development of the **Afrilearn Climate Ambassador Programme**, which educates and teaches young African students on climate, web3, and regenerative finance (ReFi) use cases in Africa. Afrilearn aims to empower nature stewards while also promoting decentralized climate activism and action.

data.title: Solatrify Nigeria
data.description: Researched and developed **Solatrify**, a ReFi project **connecting solar equipment manufacturers (OEM) to solar energy markets/projects**, including solar-powered water and irrigation systems for agriculture and reforestation projects in Africa. Solatrify promotes the water-energy-food nexus, powering sustainable development, green skills, and rural economy.

data.title: Design and deploy #MyClimateResearch bounty
data.description: #MyClimateResearch is a pilot climate research and content bounty, rewarding African students and climate ambassadors to explore, write, and publish compelling content about climate change and innovative / Indigenous solutions across in Africa. We are collaborating with Impact Miner for data collection and on-chain bounty distribution.

data.title: OSISI Pilot Garden
data.description: OSISI Garden is a pilot farm project located in Badagry Local Government Area, a tourist and coastal town in Lagos State, southwest Nigeria. The garden will serve as a hub for nursing, harvesting, and distributing tree seedlings for tree-planting initiatives in Lagos.

data.reason:
I'm happy to share an update on the OSISI pilot garden in Badagry, Lagos. As of today, we have successfully nursed over 100 coconut tree seedlings that are ready to be transplanted and used in OSISI tree planting events. By establishing this pilot garden, we've gained valuable insights into several key aspects of tree planting:

1) Unit Cost Analysis: Understanding the cost of producing tree seedlings is crucial for scaling up tree planting efforts and creating sustainable environmental programs.

2) Distribution Methods: The pilot has allowed us to test and refine strategies for distributing tree seedlings, which can inform future large-scale tree planting events.

3) Problem Identification: By closely monitoring the garden, you've been able to identify and potentially address challenges in the tree nursery process.

**Project activities include** 

1) Land leasing 

2) Land clearing

3) Water installation     

4. Sourcing of coconut seeds 

5. Nursing seedlings 


**Why Does It Matter?**
Coconut holds significant cultural, economic, and environmental importance for Badagry and Lagos. The multifaceted significance includes:

1) Cultural and Historical Significance:
Badagry has a long coastal history where coconut trees have been integral to local communities' way of life, used in cuisine, traditional medicine, and various cultural practices. 

2) Economic Importance:
Badagry is nicknamed the coconut capital of Lagos and home to the largest coconut market (Agbalata market) in Nigeria. Coconut provides multiple income streams for local communities. **Documentary of Badagry coconut market:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XXX9TbUe28c 

3) Environmental Benefits:
Coconut trees are excellent for coastal erosion prevention. They provide natural windbreaks, protect agricultural lands, and help stabilize sandy soils in coastal regions like Badagry. Support local biodiversity by creating habitats for various species


**Proof Of Work** 

https://tinyurl.com/OSISIGARDEN

I'm happy to share an update on the OSISI pilot garden in Badagry, Lagos. As of today, we have successfully nursed over 100 coconut tree seedlings that are ready to be transplanted and used in OSISI tree planting events. By establishing this pilot garden, you've gained valuable insights into several key aspects of tree planting:
1) Unit Cost Analysis: Understanding the cost of producing tree seedlings is crucial for scaling up tree planting efforts and creating sustainable environmental programs.
2) Distribution Methods: The pilot has allowed you to test and refine strategies for distributing tree seedlings, which can inform future large-scale tree planting events.
3) Problem Identification: By closely monitoring the garden, you've been able to identify and potentially address challenges in the tree nursery process.

**Project activities include** 
1) Land leasing 
2) Land clearing
3) Water installation     
4. Sourcing of coconut seeds from coastal communities 
5. Nursing and care 

**Proof Of Work:** https://tinyurl.com/OSISIGARDEN 

**Why Coconut?**
Coconut is a nutritious food source rich in minerals and vitamins and provides a sustainable crop that can thrive in the coastal climate. Relatively low maintenance compared to other agricultural crops. Coconut trees are particularly beneficial as they provide multiple environmental and economic advantages, including:
Carbon sequestration
Potential economic opportunities for local communities
Soil stabilization
Habitat creation for local wildlife


**Why Does It Matter to Badagry People?**
Coconut holds significant cultural, economic, and environmental importance for Badagry and Lagos. The multifaceted significance includes:

1) Cultural and Historical Significance:
Badagry has a long coastal history where coconut trees have been integral to local communities' way of life
Coconut has been traditionally used in cuisine, traditional medicine, and various cultural practices. The tree represents resilience and adaptability in coastal ecosystems

2) Economic Importance:
Badagry is nicknamed the coconut capital of Lagos and home to the largest coconut market (Agbalata market) in Nigeria. Coconut provides multiple income streams for local communities. The entire coconut tree is economically valuable to Badagry people:  
Coconut meat can be sold fresh or processed into products
Coconut oil is a valuable export commodity
Coconut water is a popular beverage
Coconut shells and husks can be used for crafts, biochar, fuel, and agricultural purposes
Creates employment opportunities in farming, processing, and trading

**Documentary of Badagry coconut market:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XXX9TbUe28c 

3) Environmental Benefits:
Coconut trees are excellent for coastal erosion prevention. They provide natural windbreaks, protect agricultural lands, and help stabilize sandy soils in coastal regions like Badagry. Support local biodiversity by creating habitats for various species
